abstract: The idiosyncratic doctor with no bedside manner made a triumphant return to Fox’s line-up Tuesday, as “House” once again dominated the night’s ratings one week after baseball playoffs pre-empted the show. The medical mystery drama drew 17.9 million viewers at 9 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates, edging past ABC’s “Dancing With the Stars” results episode in the same time slot (17.8 million) while outpacing all of its competitors among adults 18 to 49.
lead_paragraph: The idiosyncratic doctor with no bedside manner made a triumphant return to Fox’s line-up Tuesday, as “House” once again dominated the night’s ratings one week after baseball playoffs pre-empted the show. The medical mystery drama drew 17.9 million viewers at 9 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates, edging past ABC’s “Dancing With the Stars” results episode in the same time slot (17.8 million) while outpacing all of its competitors among adults 18 to 49.

headline.main: He May Be Cranky, But Viewers Love Him
